title: 110_hr1376
content: The "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007 mandates coverage for independent foster care adolescents under Medicaid. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act to include this category. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding the redesignation of subclauses and paragraphs in various sections. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve redesignating subclauses and paragraphs in different sections. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve redesignating subclauses and paragraphs in different sections, such as changing numbers in subsections and inserting new references. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changing references in various sections, such as replacing numbers in subsections with new ones. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve updating references in different sections by replacing specific numbers with new ones, effective from October 1, 2007. Amendments to the Social Security Act require State legislation for compliance, with exceptions for meeting additional requirements by a specified date after the State legislature session. Amendments to the Social Security Act require State legislation to meet additional requirements by a specified date after the State legislature session, with a provision for states with a 2-year legislative session to be considered separate regular sessions.
